metadata.Title: CVE-2016-6313 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - high.
metadata.Description:
The mixing functions in the random number generator in Libgcrypt before 1.5.6, 1.6.x before 1.6.6, and 1.7.x before 1.7.3 and GnuPG before 1.4.21 make it easier for attackers to obtain the values of 160 bits by leveraging knowledge of the previous 4640 bits.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-6313` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

gnupg - 1.4.20-1ubuntu3.1
gnupg-curl - 1.4.20-1ubuntu3.1
gpgv - 1.4.20-1ubuntu3.1
No subscription required

libgcrypt20 - 1.6.5-2ubuntu0.2
No subscription required

notes.Note: mdeslaur> CVE number in announcement is wrong

criterions.comment: gnupg package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.4.20-1ubuntu3.1').
libgcrypt20 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.6.5-2ubuntu0.2').
